subject: Re: Class Not Found
msgSnippet: Lets assume that you have junit installed on c: junit3.7 set your classpath to CLASSPATH=.;%CLASSPATH%;c: junit3.7 junit.jar;c: junit3.7 Once this is set
messageBody:
Lets assume that you have junit installed on c:\junit3.7

set your classpath to

CLASSPATH=.;%CLASSPATH%;c:\junit3.7\junit.jar;c:\junit3.7

Once this is set nothing can stop you from running the junit tests
from any location.

It needs the junit.jar for loading junit classes and just c:\junit3.7
for loading examples.

What went wrong:

It is difficult to tell because %CLASSPATH% that you added would have
probably brought in the ".;" which is important to know the locations
of classes from the program exectuion directory which in your case
happens to be c:\junit3.7

If you still have question let me know.

- Nilesh
